summary: Anathema: “You got really drunk last night” Crowley:”What do you mean?” Anathema: You started hitting on your husband Aziraphale...
body:
Anathema: “You got really drunk last night”

Crowley:”What do you mean?”

Anathema: You started hitting on your husband Aziraphale asking if he was single and then started crying when he said he was married”

summary: You cannot convince me that Crowley doesn’t angrily put together a dozen Valentine’s Day card for Aziraphale. Because there’s no...
body:
You cannot convince me that Crowley doesn’t angrily put together a dozen Valentine’s Day card for Aziraphale. Because there’s no way in hell that his angel isn’t gonna know how much he loves him on a day that specifies love.

Because if he has to see Aziraphale throw one more sad and lonely look at the Valentine’s Day decorations that are practically littering every store… Then he’s gonna rip his hair out from pure frustration.

reblog.comment:

You cannot convince me that Crowley doesn’t angrily put together a dozen Valentine’s Day card for Aziraphale. Because there’s no way in hell that his angel isn’t gonna know how much he loves him on a day that specifies love.

Because if he has to see Aziraphale throw one more sad and lonely look at the Valentine’s Day decorations that are practically littering every store… Then he’s gonna rip his hair out from pure frustration.
trail.content:
You cannot convince me that Crowley doesn’t angrily put together a dozen Valentine’s Day card for Aziraphale. Because there’s no way in hell that his angel isn’t gonna know how much he loves him on a day that specifies love.

Because if he has to see Aziraphale throw one more sad and lonely look at the Valentine’s Day decorations that are practically littering every store… Then he’s gonna rip his hair out from pure frustration.

blog.name: dykeiel
blog.title: and a nightingale sang in berkeley square
blog.description: lev / 18 / they / lesbian / infp / scorpio / multifandom / neil gaiman do not interact

tags: feel free to dispute this btw i love hearing ppls opinions
but i am right. just so you all know
summary: i didn't follow you and obsessively go through your blog to NOT see the top ten gay moments
question: i didn't follow you and obsessively go through your blog to NOT see the top ten gay moments
answer:
ok ok ok I didn’t expect ppl to actually care about my opinions but here we go

Lev dykeiel’s top ten GAYEST moments in Good Omens (2019)

10) their meeting in Eden: I mean what can you say, really? this is where it all started….the birth of the ORIGINAL gays……it all started right here, October 28th 4004BC….. crowley’s face when aziraphale tells him about the sword, aziraphale’s face when crowley says he can’t do anything wrong, the WING UMBRELLA….literally everything a meet cute needs. from eden plays softly in the distance

9) when Crowley miracles the paintball stain off aziraphale’s coat: just….the TENDERNESS of it all, arguably crowley’s softest moment, aziraphale playing him like a celestial harp to make him do nice things even though you KNOW crowley would’ve done it anyway…..it’s all so gentle man I can’t handle it

8) their argument outside the bookshop: this one deserved a spot just for the inclusion of TWO of the seven times crowley calls aziraphale “angel” (nah seriously I still don’t understand why that was necessary either). and if that wasn’t enough, some guy thinks they’re a couple. like ok….we get it they’re gay lmfao

7) when they’re sat in Berkeley Square: UGH just….the absolute DYNAMIC in this scene!!!! they’re giggling about defying heaven and hell together after 6000 years of living in fear…..the GROWTH. the LOVE. “Temptation accomplished!” the ACCEPTANCE!!!!

6) the bandstand: do I need to elaborate. the raw unadulterated REPRESSION of this scene sent me hurtling into orbit. Crowley asking aziraphale to run away with him. Aziraphale FULLY tearing up because of how much it hurts him to say no. I hate it. when the show first got leaked I only managed to see up to here before the first code got cut off and I had to go outside and scream and punch a hedge. I HATE it

5) Nazi church: I know we’ve sort of got over this at this point but I would like to reiterate: CROWLEY RAN INTO A FUCKING CHURCH TO SAVE AZIRAPHALE FROM A GANG OF FUCKING NAZIS, THREW AN ENTIRE AIR RAID OFF COURSE TO HAVE THEM BOMB THE CHURCH INSTEAD, AND STILL TOOK THE TIME TO SAVE AZIRAPHALE’S STUPID BOOKS. this is literally the moment Douglas and Michael said aziraphale realised he was in love with crowley!!!!!!! i! am!! feral!!!!

4) 1967, aka the holy water scene: seven words. You Go Too Fast For Me, Crowley

3) when Crowley is drunk in the bar and aziraphale finds him: bro I cannot even begin to articulate what this scene makes me feel….like I probably could if I took some time but two slow dancers by mitski is playing as I’m writing this and i’m about to have a heart attack so like. just trust me. it Does It To Me every time. everything about it like. this was the moment it went from subtext to just being Right Fucking There….. the music….. David’s ACTING…… “I lost my best friend”….. “WHEREVER YOU ARE, I’LL COME TO YOU”??????? it’s so much man I can’t even think about it just trust me it’s the best scene in the show shut up

2) when they’re sat on a bench in tadfield waiting for the bus: I’ve said it before and I’ll say it again: THE ABSOLUTE REPRESSION OF IT ALL!!!!!! my heart ACHES just thinking about aziraphale’s face journeys after crowley invites him to stay with him. the YEARNING. the FEAR. the TENDERNESS. this is the one scene I still can’t watch without tearing up. it’s fucking unreal man. the track that plays behind it is called “life after death” and it makes me crave exactly that but without the life part

1) “to the world”: THAT CERTAIN NIGHT… THE NIGHT WE MET… THERE WAS MAGIC ABROAD IN THE AIR….. THERE WERE ANGELS DINING AT THE RITZ…… AND A NIGHTINGALE SANG IN BERKELEY SQUARE……….

summary: my fam watches gomens
title: my fam watches gomens
body:
For me this is the 4th time watching Good Omens but for my mom and brother this is the first. So I’m taking notes on their first impression of it cause I’m very interested in how the Straights™ view this show, but I’m taking notes of everything tbh

I’ll be reblogging this post with the notes on every episode as we watch them. Oh and I’m tagging this with “my fam watches gomens” so block that if you don’t care ;)

Episode 1 - In The Beginning:

  • My mom went “awww” when Aziraphale covered Crowley from the rain with his wing.
  • They both felt sad about Baby B and want to know who raised him. (guess they gotta read the book now lol)
  • My mom got all the references to The Sound of Music
  • They think Aziraphale making the little “woah” sounds while doing magic is cute.
  • They love Dog.
  • My mom is really enjoying Queen.
  • Mom finds Crowley’s walk hilarious.
  • My brother loves the narration based jokes, like the blink bit between Mary Loquacious and Theresa.
  • Mom loved Nanny Crowley.
  • My brother likes it when they say “young Warlock” cause it reminds him of Merlin :’)

reblog.comment:

summary: GOOD OMENS IS NOT QUEERBAITING AND HERES WHY (By: Tessa’s Dad.)
body:
GOOD OMENS IS NOT QUEERBAITING AND HERES WHY (By: Tessa’s Dad.)

1. They’re a demon and a angle. They don’t go by human labels.

2. A relationship (between two people that love each other) DOES NOT have to be physical.

reblog.comment:
GOOD OMENS IS NOT QUEERBAITING AND HERES WHY (By: Tessa’s Dad.)

1. They’re a demon and a angle. They don’t go by human labels.

2. A relationship (between two people that love each other) DOES NOT have to be physical.

trail.content_raw:
GOOD OMENS IS NOT QUEERBAITING AND HERES WHY (By: Tessa’s Dad.)

1. They’re a demon and a angle. They don’t go by human labels.

2. A relationship (between two people that love each other) DOES NOT have to be physical.

GOOD OMENS IS NOT QUEERBAITING AND HERES WHY (By: Tessa’s Dad.)

summary: A Domestic Afternoon
title: A Domestic Afternoon
body:
Summary:

In which Aziraphale and Crowley finally have some time to be comfortable together after that whole unpleasant armageddon business.


‘You’ve had rather a disastrous day, haven’t you dear?’ Aziraphale tried his absolute damnedest – no heavenedest(he had absolutely no idea if that were a saying at all but did not care in the slightest) – oh did it even matter anymore? – not to laugh as Crowley slunk into the bookshop absolutely covered in what appeared to be a combination of river algae, melted cherry and chocolate ice cream, and bird droppings. ‘What in the world happened? No, don’t answer. We should get you cleaned up first. The miracle way or the human way?’

‘You offering to do the dirty work, angel?’ Crowley looked surprised behind his designer (part of the new collection, which oddly, looked almost exactly like the previous one but cost twice as much) sunglasses. ‘I thought you were utterly and imperishably opposed to frivolous miracles or something to that effect.’

‘This is no frivolous matter,’ Aziraphale looked affronted by the thought, and also seemed to determinedly ignore the fact that Crowley had indeed perfectly quoted him, haughty tone and all. He concentrated carefully, and within minutes, every millimetre of Crowley was pristine.

The demon looked down and tutted at the new shoes and tie that had so miraculously appeared on his person. ‘Angel. We’ve talked about this. I don’t go updating your wardrobe* even though it desperately needs it.’(*The anymore was left unsaid, they both clearly remembered the absolute disaster of a row they’d had when Crowley had replaced his favourite angel’s tartan tie and trousers with leather and studs.)

‘Oh yes, terribly sorry,’ Aziraphale sheepishly returned them to normal. He flipped the Closed sign to face outwards and bolted the shop door, despite having only just opened, and led Crowley into the back room, dithering about between the coffee maker and the wine before finally settling on the coffee maker and pulling out some alcoholised coffee additive. ‘Sit down, dear, sit, and tell me all about what in the world happened.’

‘Not much to tell,’ Crowley shrugged, watching the angel fuss with the coffee cups as he waited for the coffee to brew fondly. He thought it was incredibly endearing the way the angel still made such a fuss over such a silly thing as coffee to offer well, what amounted to his only guest that ever dropped by. He knew it was simply a deeply-ingrained part of who the angel was to be a good host, but Crowley hoped at least some of it was out of care and deference to Crowley himself.

‘Well, tell me the not much anyways,’ Aziraphale prompted, pouring and spiking their coffees and heading over to perch on the sofa next to Crowley, handing him the coffee.

[Keep reading on AO3!]

Music by The Velvet Underground

Anything that you might do

I’m gonna do too

blog.name: tinsnip
blog.title: No, said Aziraphale, it's ineffable.
blog.description:
Hello, I'm tinsnip.

Feeling rather ineffable these days. Expect a great deal of Good Omens.

Other interests: Star Trek. (Primarily DS9 and Cardassians.)
Pratchett. Wodehouse.
Cats. The Doctors Whom. Science. Cute things. Life truths. Pixels. And spiders, sometimes, so keep that in mind.

I post fic on AO3. It's quite good - you should have a look.

My work with Vyc on a Kardasi conlang is here.

Cardassian meta is found mostly under cardassians or kardasi.

If you enjoy my fanfic, why not buy me a coffee?

Crowley, for the last 6000 years: You’re my ride or die my home skillet biscuit you know what I mean and let me tell you this.. if a bitch ever tries you bitch LET ME KNOW and we will set this shit off. Ugh alright bestie. You’re my everything and have an amazing day bitch. LOVE YOU BITCH
